meanings.definition: Establish the truth or correctness of (something previously believed or suspected).
meanings.sent1: She was confirming the time of the meeting with her boss.
meanings.sent2: The email confirming the flight details arrived just in time.
meanings.sent3: After confirming the recipe, she realized she forgot the main ingredient.
meanings.sent4: His smile confirming her suspicions that he was up to something mischievous.
meanings.sent5: The scientist's experiment confirming the theory was groundbreaking.

meanings.definition: Make a formal statement or announcement about (something).
meanings.sent1: The spokesperson was confirming the company's new policy.
meanings.sent2: The press release confirming the merger caused a stir in the industry.
meanings.sent3: After confirming the news, the reporter rushed to broadcast it.
meanings.sent4: Her confident tone confirming the decision left no room for doubt.
meanings.sent5: The judge confirming the verdict brought closure to the case.

meanings.definition: Give approval to (someone or something) officially.
meanings.sent1: The board was confirming the candidate for the position.
meanings.sent2: The committee confirming the budget allocation was crucial for the project.
meanings.sent3: After confirming the request, the manager signed the document.
meanings.sent4: The principal confirming the student's project praised its creativity.
meanings.sent5: The mayor confirming the event boosted community morale.
